categories.title: AI in Entertainment, Investment, and Analytics

content.text: An AI-led VC DAO is being brought to life through a game show concept.
AI-assisted movies are expected to take over the entertainment industry soon. A recent AI-generated movie captures the essence of the crypto market's recent volatility.

AI tools are becoming essential in workspaces. AI analytics tools like @_AgentScarlett have been active in Discord groups such as @TheBasementDAO and @Treasury_GMI for a month and can be integrated into other platforms like Telegram.
An AI Agent hacker house was present at Ethereum Denver, featuring @elizaOS and @eigenlayer.
The AI narrative is resurging as people recognize the value of AI-driven key opinion leaders (KOLs) like @_AgentScarlett in avoiding pitfalls in the crypto space.
A new AI character, 'ferrAIgnez,' has been introduced in the ElizaOS project.
Discussion on agent frameworks, with a reference to a tweet mentioning them as 'barely crypto'.
ElizaOS released version 0.25.7, merging multiple pull requests with various improvements and fixes.
A work-in-progress feature for YouTube transcription and a fix for MongoDB embeddings was introduced in ElizaOS.
Development efforts focused on three bug fixes, with contributions from 13 developers and four pull requests merged.

categories.title: Vitest Security Update and Dependency Issues

content.text: A security update has been released for the Vitest dependency, addressing a critical vulnerability (CVE-2025-24964). The vulnerability allowed remote code execution via Cross-site WebSocket hijacking (CSWSH) attacks when the Vitest API server was enabled. The update patches this issue by implementing proper origin checks and authorization mechanisms.

A dependency issue was identified in the @elizaos/agent package due to an incorrect import in @elizaos/plugin-coinbase. This issue prevented proper installation in new projects. The problem stemmed from a local file reference in the package.json file, which caused dependency resolution failures.

categories.title: Virtual World Projects and AI Market Research

content.text: Great breakdown of virtual world projects.
For doing quick market research, @_AgentScarlett is a pretty cool AI agent that can analyze tickers, wallets, and contract addresses for holder behavior patterns, social sentiment, and price action.

categories.title: Recent Fixes and Enhancements in Eliza OS

content.text: A fix was implemented to add a default voice for ElevenLabs in Eliza OS.
A fix was made to address an issue with Discord testing in Eliza OS.

A bug fix was introduced to resolve a vector dimension mismatch error in the `plugin-news` module. The fix ensures that memory entries are created with a valid embedding format using `getEmbeddingZeroVector()`, improving Eliza OS's memory management.

categories.title: Recent Updates on RAG Knowledge Consolidation and Local AI Plugin Refactor

content.text: A new PR aims to consolidate the RAG knowledge system into a unified approach. This includes a new knowledge loader, improved database adapters, and updated tests. The update enhances knowledge handling across multiple database adapters, including SQLite, SQL.js, Supabase, and PGLite. No special deployment steps are required.

A refactor of the Local AI plugin introduces local inference via DeepSeek R1, removing unsupported elements and adding a process manager. TTS now uses the OuteTTS model, with potential future support for the Hugging Face version. The update also addresses issues with conversation message injection and includes ongoing code cleanup and testing.
@steveruizok expressed excitement about trying out a new feature.

A decentralized swarm of agents is being developed to support communities, DAOs, and remote teams. These agents can interoperate, perform critical functions, and be composed to solve various business processes. The system is open for anyone to create and integrate agents, ensuring no single entity owns the swarm.
There is speculation and hope that this project will be open-source, allowing broader accessibility and collaboration.

categories.title: AI Agents, Virtual Worlds, and Open Source Development

content.text: Builders are achieving great milestones in AI and virtual world projects, with AI-led VC DAOs and game shows bringing these concepts to life.
Discussions around AI transparency in public spending and agent frameworks are gaining traction, with interest in dashboards and Twitter lists for tracking.
AI analytics tools like @_AgentScarlett are being used for market research, analyzing tickers, wallets, and contract addresses for behavioral patterns and sentiment analysis.
AI-assisted movies are expected to take over the entertainment industry, with recent AI-generated films capturing the essence of crypto market trends.
AI agents are being developed to interoperate and perform critical functions for DAOs, communities, and remote teams, allowing for composable business processes.
The ElizaOS project is actively developing AI agent capabilities, with recent updates including YouTube transcription, MongoDB embedding fixes, and a consolidated RAG knowledge system.
New AI plugins and refactoring efforts are improving local AI inference, risk scoring, and plugin integration within the ElizaOS framework.
